task.title: How to create a GitHub repository
task.shortdesc: The GitHub platform is a blend between a cloud storage for code and a social network. Creating a repository on GitHub is like creating a folder in cloud storage and will allow you to save the content you create to that GitHub repository.

context.p: Other users will be able to see your repository and will be able to branch and edit if they want to adapt from it. This is the social media aspect of GitHub where developers can collaborate on ideas.

step.cmd: After you create an account on GitHub and have downloaded the GitHub Desktop app, open the app and log in.
Select the plus sign icon in the upper left hand corner.
In the window that opens, select "Create".
Name the repository using all lowercase and without spaces or punctuation
Designate the folder path in your computer that makes sense to you.
Select "Create Repository" and you're good to go.
